citeinfo.origin: WorldPop (School of Geography and Environmental Science, University of Southampton).
citeinfo.title: Bottom-up gridded population estimates for individual age-sex groups in Nigeria, version 1.2.1.

pubinfo.publish: WorldPop Research Group, University of Southampton

descript.abstract: This geotiff raster contains estimates of total population size in individual age-sex groups for each 100 m grid cell across Nigeria. The values are the mean of the posterior probability distribution for the predicted population size in each grid cell. NA values represent areas that were mapped as unsettled by LandScanHD v1.1 (Oak Ridge National Laboratory 2018). These data are stored as floating point numbers rather than integers to avoid rounding errors in aggregated population totals for larger areas. The file names refer to the age-sex group represented by the raster. Filenames beginning with “f” are female populations and filenames beginning with “m” are male populations. The age group labels refer to the first year of the age range. For example: “f0” is females less than one year old. “f1” is females 1 to 4 years old. “f5” is females 5 to 9 years old. “f10” is females 10 to 14 years old. This pattern continues for each 5 year interval up to 80. “f80” is females greater than 80 years old. The labelling is the same for males: “m0”, “m1”, “m5”, “m10”, … , “m80”.
descript.purpose: This geotiff raster provides population estimates for individual age-sex groups within 100 m grid cells across Nigeria.

theme.themekey: Human population, Sub-national, Spatial dataset, Bayesian statistics

cntorgp.cntorg: WorldPop Research Group, University of Southampton

idinfo.datacred: These population estimates were produced by the WorldPop Research Group at the University of Southampton. This work was part of the GRID3 project with funding from the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation and the United Kingdom’s Department for International Development (OPP1182408). Project partners included the United Nations Population Fund, Columbia University’s Center for International Earth Science Information Network, and the Flowminder Foundation. These data may be distributed using a Creative Commons Attribution Share-Alike 4.0 License. Contact release@worldpop.org for more information.
idinfo.native: R version 3.6.3 (2020-02-29) running on Windows >= 8 x64
